conclusion: A right-angle wire is placed in a uniform magnetic field.
Wire is folded into a right angle with sides ac = L and cd = 2L.
Magnetic field B is uniform and perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
Current I flows through the wire in the direction shown.
Force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = I L x B.
Force on segment ac is calculated as F_ac = ILB.
Force on segment cd is calculated as F_cd = 2ILB.
Total force is calculated using Pythagorean theorem: F_total = sqrt(5) * ILB.
Magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the wire is sqrt(5) * ILB.
